title: Senior Manager Of Sponsored Events

description:
Company Overview:

Do you enjoy making a difference in a child's life, transforming education, and evolving learning? Come join Teachstone, the interactions company! Teachstone® was founded in 2008 to deliver the Classroom Assessment Scoring System® (CLASS®) nationwide and around the globe. Developed through years of research, the CLASS system measures and improves the interactions between educators and children, which have been shown to drive learning and lifelong achievement. Our online subscription service, myTeachstone, simplifies CLASS implementation by combining observation data with a robust library of CLASS resources and professional development.

At Teachstone, everything we do is about improving the ways educators interact with children. We train instructional coaches and observers, build and deliver online support programs, and design professional development for educators — all of it proven to improve children’s social, emotional, and academic success. By helping educators focus, measure, and improve their interactions and relationships with children, Teachstone is transforming education nationwide, one interaction at a time.

Role Overview:

The Senior Manager of Sponsored Events will collaborate with the event team to develop and implement event strategy and playbooks for internal and external events by aligning event strategy with Teachstone’s business strategy. This leader will determine event goals and objectives in consultation with senior management and the Senior Manager of Teachstone Hosted Events to deliver annual and quarterly plans. The Senior Manager will ensure each event realizes its full business potential through a defined event development process owned and implemented by the team.

This role will collaborate with sales leaders to optimize event opportunities including building relationships with associations and event partners and identify new ways to sponsor and participate. Working with the broader team, this leader will build out an events playbook, reporting framework, and quarterly analysis of the effectiveness of our event investments. The manager will establish and grow partnerships with key event stakeholders, strategic partners and suppliers using excellent verbal and written communication skills to build regular cadence of communication, feedback and opportunity

—----------------------------------------------------------

Role Responsibilities:
• Lead the strategic planning of sponsored/paid events, delivering an annual plan and communication strategy to make sure the value, objectives, expectation, and outcomes of our event investments are well understood
• Oversee the planning, coordination, and execution of events and partner/sponsor relationships, including conferences, meetings, trade shows, and other unique opportunities to give Teachstone visibility
• Manage event budgets, including tracking expenses and ROI against the objectives for participation and sponsoring
• Negotiate contracts and sponsorships
• Source and manage exhibit services vendors
• Develop and maintain ongoing relationships with event partners, sponsors, and vendors throughout the year
• Create and distribute event materials, including invitations, programs, and promotional materials
• Monitor event activities to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations
• Supervise and train event staff, including volunteers
• Evaluate event success and prepare post-event reports
• Stay up-to-date on event industry trends and best practices
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills to build regular cadence of communication and feedback.
• Extremely organized with great attention to detail
• Change Management
• Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, education or related field.
• 7 or more years of business, marketing, or PreK-12 education industry experience managing paid events and sponsorships.
• Demonstrable ability to strategize approaches to events that maximize brand, lead gen and partnership development.
• Excellent project management skills and ability to define a process for event management that will drive measurable results
• Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

Role Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience in the education market is preferred, with an emphasis on early education.
• Digital marketing and analytics experience.

Teachstone is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider all applicants without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic data, political affiliation, or any other status protected by law. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse culture.
